sentence.Network_en: It remained an exceptionally rare book until it was reprinted in 1918.
sentence.Network_cn: 在1918年再版之前，这本书一直非常罕见。

sentence.Network_en: Exceptionally, in times of emergency, we may send a team of experts.
sentence.Network_cn: 在紧急情况下，我们可能会破例派一个专家小组。

sentence.Network_en: The merchandise is reasonably priced and offers exceptionally good value.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些商品定价合理，很是划算。

格外的近义词 ... [very;extremely] 很;极。特别 [exceptionally] 格外 [particular;specially] 特地;特意.

list.abs: 他们坚信美国例外主义（American exceptionalism），深切质疑美国创建自由世界秩序的能力。目前美国国内外形势的变化为奉行这 …
美国卓异主义(American Exceptionalism)为亚历西斯•托克维里于1831年所杜撰之词句。在历史上，此辞意指美利坚合众国因具独一无 …
exception 除外exceptionable 可反对的exceptionably 可以反对地
但是就我的专题方向——中国城市发展——而言，上海其实是例外主义（exceptionalism）的演绎。因为它太过于特殊，在中国找不到 …
exceptionable 可反对的exceptionably 可以反对地exceptional 异常的

entry.def: You use exceptional to describe someone or something that has a particular quality, usually a good quality, to an unusually high degree.

example.tran: 具有非凡才能的孩子们

example.ex: His translation is exceptional in its poetic quality.

entry.def: Exceptional situations and incidents are unusual and only likely to happen very infrequently.

example.ex: ...if the courts hold that this case is exceptional...
example.tran: 如果法庭认为这是个特殊案例

example.ex: School governors have the discretion to allow parents to withdraw pupils in exceptional circumstances.
example.tran: 督学可以酌情允许父母在特殊情况下让学生退学。

stems_affixes.word_buile: basic基本的+ally……地→adv.基本上,主要地
synthetic合成的+ally……地→adv.综合地,合成地
systematic系统的,体系的+ally……地→adv.系统地,有规则地

sentences.cn: 一场异常猛烈的暴风雨

sentences.en: An exceptionally violent cyclone hit the town last night.
sentences.cn: 昨晚异常猛烈的旋风吹袭了那个小镇。

sentences.en: She sings in an exceptionally pure soprano.
sentences.cn: 她以异常纯美的高音歌唱。
